metadata.feature_description: Control post visibility with different privacy levels

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with 'Everyone' privacy on site page

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream module loads with post input area
steps.actual: Activity Stream loaded successfully with 'Tell the world something...' placeholder

steps.action: Click on post input area to expand it
steps.expected: Post area expands with Share button and icons visible
steps.actual: Post area expanded showing Share button and privacy icon

steps.action: Click eye icon to open privacy menu
steps.expected: Privacy dropdown appears with available options
steps.actual: Privacy menu opened showing 'Everyone' and 'Community Members' options (site context shows only 2 options)

steps.expected: Post created with Everyone privacy setting
steps.actual: Post 'Testing privacy settings' created successfully with Everyone privacy

steps.action: Verify post appears in activity stream
steps.expected: New post visible in activity stream
steps.actual: Post visible in activity stream with timestamp 'moments ago'

steps.action: On Community page, verify 'Community Members' option is available
steps.expected: Community Members option visible in privacy dropdown
steps.actual: Community Members option confirmed available in privacy menu on site/Community page context

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with 'Friends' privacy on profile page

steps.action: Navigate to user profile page Activity Feed
steps.expected: Profile page loads with Activity Feed showing more privacy options

steps.action: Open privacy dropdown on profile page
steps.expected: Privacy menu shows 4 options: Everyone, Community Members, Friends, Private
steps.actual: Privacy menu displays all 4 options as expected on profile page context
Friends option selected successfully (radio button checked)

steps.expected: Post created with Friends privacy setting
steps.actual: Post 'Testing profile privacy options' created with Friends privacy

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with 'Private' privacy on profile page

steps.action: On profile page, verify 'Private' option is available
steps.expected: Private option visible in privacy dropdown
steps.actual: Private option confirmed available in privacy menu on profile page

steps.action: Enter text and prepare to post with Private privacy
steps.expected: Post input area accepts text with privacy settings available
steps.actual: Text 'Testing Private privacy setting' entered in post area

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with 'Group Members' privacy in group context

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test Group Activity page
steps.expected: Group Activity Stream loads with group-specific features
steps.actual: Wiki Test Group Activity page loaded at groupid/10

steps.action: Verify existing post with Group Members privacy is visible
steps.expected: Post with Group Members privacy visible to group member
steps.actual: Found existing post: 'Testing Group Members privacy option - this post should only be visible to group members'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify privacy options change based on context

steps.action: Compare privacy options on site page vs profile page
steps.expected: Different contexts show different privacy options based on code logic
steps.actual: Site/Community page: 2 options (Everyone, Community Members). Profile page: 4 options (Everyone, Community Members, Friends, Private). Group page: Group Members option available. This matches the code in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify post visibility for different user types

steps.action: Verify superuser can see all posts in all contexts
steps.expected: Superuser has access to view all posts
steps.actual: As superuser (host), all posts are visible including posts with various privacy settings in Community, Profile, and Group contexts

steps.action: Open privacy menu and check default selection
steps.actual: Privacy menu shows 'Everyone' as the default selection (code confirms securitySet defaults to 'E' for Everyone)

observations: Privacy options are context-dependent: Site pages show Everyone + Community Members; Profile pages add Friends + Private options; Group pages include Group Members option
The security codes used in the backend are: E=Everyone, C=Community, F=Friends, U=Private/User, R=GroupMembers (from ActivityStreamServicesController.cs)
The privacy menu is implemented using Knockout.js observable (isSecurityMenuOpen) and radio buttons in a securityMenu div
Privacy inheritance in comments was not directly testable - comments appear to inherit visibility from parent post based on code structure
Change privacy after posting feature was not found in the UI - posts do not appear to have an edit privacy option after creation
